page.title: 09Spinning in Elton
page.content: A lady in the village of Elton still practises the old art of spinning.She heard the story of Sleeping Beauty when she was a little girl and her interest was aroused.She bought her first spinning wheel during a Scottish holiday.She went to lessons and practised at home.The stages of spinning are washing the fleece and letting it dry,combing the best bits and rolling them into sausage shapes ready for spinning.Two or three strands are wound together to make thread for knitting or weaving.She dyes the wool,often using natural dyes from plants.She is good enough now to lecture locally on the subject.It is five years since she started this hobby and she says it is very restful.
